snippet: Congress should do more to help graduates mired in student loan debt find a way to make payments and meet their obligations.
abstract: Editorial examines plight of those struggling to keep up with private student loan payments; notes that they lack deferred payment options and other hardship clauses that come with federal loans; observes that federal regulators have struggled to effect change amid mounting consumer complaints; calls on Congress to step in and force private lenders to offer modified payment schedules.
lead_paragraph: Congress should do more to help graduates mired in student loan debt find a way to make payments and meet their obligations.
